intro: Behuria glazioviana, commonly known as the Glaziovian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branching. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
